column1: Kartarpur is a town near the city of Jalandhar and is located in the Doaba region of the state. It was founded by the fifth Guru of Sikhs
Kartarpur is located at 31.44°N 75.5°E﻿ / 31.44; 75.5. It has an average elevation of 228 metres (748 feet).
It is situated at a distance of 15 km from Jalandhar towards Amritsar on G.T. Road (National Highway 1).

column3: 152. Males constitute 54% of the population and females 46%. Kartarpur has an average literacy rate of 69%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 72%
column5: and female literacy is 66%. In Kartarpur
column6: 12% of the population is under 6 years of age. Kartarpur has 14 municipal wards.

column1: Jang-e-Azadi Memorial is a memorial and museum being built in Kartarpur town of Punjab
column3: in memory of contribution and sacrifices made by the Punjabi community in Indian independence movement.

column1: First Guru Granth Sahib(Adi Granth) is placed at Qila Kothi(Kartarpur Fort).
